content: The newest version that works with win 7 is 115. This link will take you there. https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/115.18.0/ select whether 32 or 64 bit, and then select preferred language. You can uninstall current version, but keep the profile After installing the newer version, you will need to update the addressbook. click tools>import>import a file and follow the links for addresssbook and select the MAB option, and then select the abook.mab from the profile. repeat the step with the history..mab from your profile. This URL can be helpful in orientation to the newer release: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/getting-started-thunderbird-main-window-supernova
creator: davidsk

content:
The following link might be helpful: Upgrading from an older version of Thunderbird https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/upgrading-older-version-thunderbird

Quotation from the above link:

During a version upgrade, some versions of Thunderbird perform data and other conversions (for example address book data) to enable new capabilities. If you skip an important version, then Thunderbird may not work, you may have missing or incorrect data, or other complications may occur. To avoid this, closely follow these directions.
creator: Yu5tiqX9og

content: - install the addon, importexporttools NG - highlight the desired folder to extract - rightclick and select importexport option to export mbox - select a location outside profile and save.
creator: davidsk

content:
If you want to exclude Local Folders from your regular backups and have them stored separately, you can do this: - exit thunderbird - locate the local folders in profile at Mail\Local Folders folder ** - COPY (not move) Local Folders to external media - restart thunderbird - click account settings and then highlight Local Folders - at bottom row is 'Local Directory' that points to Local Folder. click the dropdown menu there and select the new location. thunderbird will probably close and restart - recheck Local Folders that Local Directory is pointing properly once satisfied,you can delete the old Local Folders entry in profile. Future proflie backups will not include the Local Folders.

    • If you are unsure where profile is, do this:

- click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open profile' - exit thunderbird - you are now in profile and the Mail folder should be visible. click it and you will be at Local Folders
creator: davidsk

content: do you have an antivirus product. That sounds like it may well be blocking Thunderbird. Normally a failed connection attempt would time out in 5 minutes, that is is not indicates outside interference. The antivirus mail scanner is the most obvious place to start.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: It may help if you post the complete error message and a screenshot of your SMTP server settings pane. Thank you.

content:
It wouldn't surprise me if Sent (which is a special folder) hasn't ever been designed to work with subfolders. So it might not ever work.

What do you have stored in sent.sdb?

Is the account settings > Server Settings > set to file per message (maildir)? It if isn't then subfolders shouldn't be necessary
creator: wsmwk
